title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 July 2009 - XWiki
content:
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 11:31  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:32): im now using jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/xwiki?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8 let see what happens  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:35): hmm  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:35): no luck  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:35): java.sql.SQLException: Incorrect string value: '\xCB\x9AC of...' for column 'XWL\_VALUE' at row 1  
sdumitriu - (16/07/2009 11:35): Wrong encoding...  
sdumitriu - (16/07/2009 11:35): When do you get it, when saving, or when loading?  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:36): saving  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:37): inserting the string (38 ?C of hoger) in a blog post generates the error  
sdumitriu - (16/07/2009 11:41): But in a normal document does it work?  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:43): no it does it everywhere  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:45): i did migrate from a latin1 db  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:45): but now i have utf8 in my my.cnf, the glassfish DS, xwiki.cfg  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:45): did a full dump/restore of the DB  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:45): to be sure it would work right with utf8  
sdumitriu - (16/07/2009 11:46): Please check the charset of the XWL\_VALUE column  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:46): oh wait  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:47): i just read that the degree sign is not in UTF-8  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:47): that can't be right   
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:48): no it should be in it  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:48): its listed here http://www.utf8-chartable.de/  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:48): one sec, ill check the encoding of the column  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:50): its set to cp1252, thats not right  
mflorea left at 11:50 ("Leaving")  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:52): thats basically latin1; I guess the dump which i used for the restore had the character encondings for columns in it ?  
sdumitriu - (16/07/2009 11:53): Yes  
sdumitriu - (16/07/2009 11:53): dumps usually do that  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 11:53  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:54): ugh  
KermitTheFragger - (16/07/2009 11:54): well thanks for the help! I've got some converting to do :)
